abstracts.cdata!:
The report is a complementary
            socioeconomic, and cultural assessment of local populations
            within the area of the Road Rehabilitation Project, namely
            segment Boyuibe - Yacuiba of Road No. 9, which traverses the
            provinces of Luis Calvo and Gran Chaco, from north to south.
            Taking into account the precarious living conditions, and
            inadequate access to basic services of local populations,
            this indigenous peoples plan intends to preserve their
            cultural heritage, and improve living conditions. While the
            project is expected to prod positive impacts in terms of
            economic, social, and transport activities, as well as
            employment generation possibilities, negative impacts
            address the need for public health, and safety mitigation
            measures during construction. The presence of domestic
            animals (horses, livestock, etc.), basic for the subsistence
            of local populations, calls for an immediate fencing around
            the construction area, while public, educational campaigns
            in terms of traffic safety measures, should minimize transit
            dangers. Inadequate sewage, causing flooding, and soil
            erosion, should undergo rehabilitation to allow clean
            effluents, and prevent waterborne diseases. Indigenous
            populations' traditions should be respected, taking
            into account their way of life, within ethical, and peaceful conducts.
